definition: the bow or prow of a ship
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Heavy seas broke over the bows.
sentences.chinese: 驚濤駭浪朝着船頭衝打過來。

sentences.english: The prince is forced to kill Ursula by stabbing her with a ship.
sentences.chinese: 王子被迫用船頭刺死了厄斯拉。

sentences.english: They came over to the stem and watched the ship cutting a feather.
sentences.chinese: 他們來到船頭，看着航船破浪前進。

sentences.english: David and Lucy sat in the prow of the fishing boat and looked across the choppy water.
sentences.chinese: 大衛和露西坐在漁船船頭，凝望着煙波浩淼的水面。

sentences.english: The crew found safety at the bow of the boat.
sentences.chinese: 船員們都到船頭安全的地方躲了起來。

sentences.english: A spar rising aft from a mast to support the head of a quadrilateral fore-and-aft sail.
sentences.chinese: 從船尾桅杆伸出支撐船頭四方形的船帆的圓材。

sentences.english: Due to emergencies, we sailed in the opposite direction.
sentences.chinese: 由於緊急情況，我們撥轉了船頭。

sentences.english: I then made a pencil line around the bow where I wanted the new scribe line to be.
sentences.chinese: 當時我提出了鉛筆線靠近船頭的地方我希望新的刀線。

sentences.english: Make fast tug(s) on starboard bow.
The boat had her name blazoned on her bow.
sentences.chinese: 那小船將船名繪製在船頭上。

sentences.english: Never pole a boat from the bow.
After the ship breaks in half, the bow section sinks rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 輪船被撞成兩半以後，船頭部分應很快就沉下去。

sentences.english: Cable round the bow up and down.
The under compartments of the bow started to flood.
sentences.chinese: 船頭的隔水艙以下開始湧入海水。

sentences.english: He kneeled against the bow and, for a moment, slipped the line over his back again.
sentences.chinese: 他靠着船頭跪了一會兒，然後又把線繩背在背上。

definition: to gaze afar/to look into the distance
to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
